title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Unable to open a file in another editor if it is already open in one editor
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] When a file is already opened in one editor, there is no option to open it in another editor. An error message should be displayed in this scenario.
OB: When a file is already open in one editor, opening it in another editor is not possible. No warning or error message is displayed.
EB: When a file is already open in one editor, if an attempt is made to open it in another editor, a warning message should be displayed indicating that existing changes may be overwritten. The user should be given an option to continue or cancel.
SR:
1. Ensure that you have an associated Windows editor for your Java file.
2. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any Java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all Java files.
3. In the Java Perspective, right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. A Notepad or WordPad window will open with the Java file.
4. Close the Notepad or WordPad window.
5. Go back to the Java Perspective and open a Java file by double-clicking on it. The file should be opened in the workbench.
6. Right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
7. A warning message should be displayed in the workbench, indicating that there are existing changes and asking if you want to continue. The user should be able to choose whether to proceed or cancel the operation.
